EXIT   X

KYC OBLIGATIONS

Page

Table of Contents

 

What beneficial ownership looks like

 

Reporting entities must have procedures for determining the beneficial owner of each customer. The beneficial owner must be identified either before or as soon as practicable after the reporting entity provides the designated service to the customer.

 

The beneficial owner is the individual who owns 25% or more of the customer or controls the customer. An individual can control a customer via trusts and other arrangements, and through decisions on financial and operating policies.

 

If the customer is an individual

You can assume the customer and beneficial owner are the same person unless reasonable grounds exist to think otherwise.

 

If you can't determine whether the beneficial owner is of a company or partnership

You must identify and take reasonable measures to verify the individual who either:

 

•         is entitled to exercise 25% or more of the voting rights

•         holds the position of senior managing official

 

Similar criteria exist for determining the beneficial owner of registered cooperatives and associations. If you can't determine the beneficial owner of a trust, you must establish which individual can appoint or remove the trustees.

What beneficial ownership looks like
